content: increase in next stitch complete fin slip_stitch into the front loop of the next stitch chain 2 4 half_double_crochet chain 2 slip_stitch back into the same stitch increase in next stitch single_crochet 2 19 stitches summary single_crochet 2 increase fin increase single_crochet 5 increase fin increase single_crochet 2 = 19 stitches row 8 single_crochet 3 decrease behind the fin in the two single_crochet either side of the fin miss the back stitch from the row before single_crochet 7 decrease behind the fin missing the back stitch again single_crochet 3 15 stitches summary single_crochet 3 decrease single_crochet 7 decrease single_crochet 3 = 15 stitches row 9 change back to original colour single_crochet 15 15 stitches eyes flatten the fish so that the fins are level on either side use them as a guide to insert your safety eyes row 10 *decrease single_crochet 3* repeat around 12 stitches row 11 *decrease single_crochet 2* repeat around 9 stitches stuff start stuffing and shaping the body i prefer medium stuffing at the head with lighter stuffing towards the tail but you can stuff the fish as round as you like row 12 *decrease single_crochet 1* repeat around 6 stitches criss wall https //www ravelry com/patterns/library/all-in-one-baby-fish-fry row 13 *increase in next single_crochet single_crochet 1* repeat around 9 stitches row 14 *increase in next single_crochet single_crochet 2* repeat around 12 stitches row 15 single_crochet 12 12 stitches shape before you break the thread structure the fish and the tail into your desired shape i usually have to crochet one more single_crochet and then change colour to get to the edge if the single_crochet row hasn t ended on one of the edges ether pull out a few single_crochet or crochet around to the other edge row 16/tail squish the fish tail together vertically checking that your fins are still level on either side using the alternative colour join it in the corner of the tail you will be working through four loops both sides of the tail to join them together chain 1 2 half_double_crochet in the same stitch half_double_crochet in each stitch of the fish tail through 4 loops to the other end and 2 half_double_crochet and 1 single_crochet in the last stitch either cut the thread short and sew in or leave long to use for hanging thread it up through the fish and out the top in the middle tie a knot in it for easy hanging criss wall https //www ravelry com/patterns/library/all-in-one-baby-fish-fry criss wall https //www ravelry com/patterns/library/all-in-one-baby-fish-fry
